newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Feb 21.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Feb 21.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:
* Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd A$17.60 (-0.08)

The Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd has halted crude oil output at the Australian offshore Griffin oil field because of a tropical low weather formation, industry sources said on Thursday. The sources said the field was preparing to disconnect the floating production platform to move out of the path of the approaching storm.

U.S. corporate bonds of News Corp gained three to five basis points on Thursday on news that Cablevision Systems Corp was getting serious about buying a 50 percent stake in the Madison Square Garden properties, analysts said.

The Cossack-Pioneer offshore oil platorm has shut down production in preparation for fleeing a tropical low off the coast of Western Australia expected to build into a cyclone, a spokeswoman for the operator, Woodside Petroleum Ltd said late on Thursday.

Savage Resources Ltd said on Thursday it would raise A$53.3 million through an issue of 41 million shares to institutions at a price of A$1.30 each. Savage said the issue would be used for general corporate purposes, including development of current zinc projects and new opportunities as they arose.

Internet software developer Sausage Software Ltd said on Thursday it has revised down its earnings forecasts for the year to June 30, 1997. Sausage said the net loss was now estimated at A$5.0 million for the 1996/97 year, an increase on the previous forecast of A$2.0 million loss, with revenues now seen at A$4.0 million, compared with A$7.6 million previously. Sausage earlier reported a net loss of A$1.93 million for the six months ended December 31, 1996.

The Philippine Health Department has banned the sale of a biscuit brand produced by Sydney-based Arnotts Ltd after a poison scare in Australia, the department said on Thursday. The Health Department said the sale of Monte Carlo cream-filled biscuits would be prohibited because the brand is not registered with the Bureau of Food and Drugs (BFAD).
Intellect announced late on Thursday its net loss narrowed to A$960,000 in the first half from A$1.94 million in the comparable half a year earlier.

Eastern Aluminium Ltd, which holds 10 percent of Australia's Portland smelter, said late on Thursday a weak aluminium price and a strong Australian dollar weighed unfavourably on its bottom line in 1996. Eastern earlier on Wednesday reported a 56 percent drop in net profit to A$4.64 million for calendar 1996.
